data: Iscrizioni latine e greche dal nuovo edificio termale di Taormina
Giacomo Manganaro, «Iscrizioni latine e greche dal nuovo edificio termale di Taormina», Cronache di archeologia e di storia dell’arte 3 (1964): 38–68

The text preserved belongs to a single column of text, with the sixth fragment belonging to the same column as the others, and containing the end of the column of text; at least one further column must have stood to the right originally.
After 8 BCE (assuming that it was produced at the same time as the associated calendar), and probably Augustan rather than Tiberian (so Ruck), so between 8 BCE and 14 CE.

Assuming Manganaro's hypothesis that this side is secondary is correct, this text post-dates 96 CE. Attribution to Lucilla would date this to 164-168/9 CE.
